trans-unit.source: Represents a security token handler that creates security tokens from SAML 1.1 Assertions.

The <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSecurityTokenHandler> class serializes and deserializes security tokens backed by SAML 1.1 Assertions into <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSecurityToken> objects.
Security token handlers are responsible for creating, reading, writing, and validating tokens.

You can configure a security token service (STS) or relying party (RP) application to process SAML 1.1 Assertion-backed security tokens by adding an instance of the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSecurityTokenHandler> class to the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityTokenHandlerCollection> object configured for the service (or application).
This can be done either programmatically or in the configuration file.

The handler itself is configured from the configuration specified for the collection through the collectionâ€™s <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityTokenHandlerCollection.Configuration%2A> property when it is added to the collection.

While it is possible to configure the handler individually by setting its <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityTokenHandler.Configuration%2A> property, this is not normally necessary; however, if the handler must be configured individually, the property should be set after the handler is added to the collection.
For many scenarios, the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSecurityTokenHandler> class can be used as-is; however, the class provides many extension points through the methods it exposes.

By deriving from the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSecurityTokenHandler> and overriding specific methods, you can modify the functionality of the token processing provided in the default implementation, or you can add processing for extensions to the SAML Assertion specification that may be needed in some custom scenarios.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSecurityTokenHandler"></xref> class with default security token requirements.

The <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSecurityTokenHandler.SamlSecurityTokenRequirement%2A> property is set to an instance of <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSecurityTokenRequirement> that is created with the default constructor.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSecurityTokenHandler"></xref> class with the specified security token requirements.
The <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSecurityTokenRequirement"></xref> to be used by this instance when validating tokens.
Sets the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSecurityTokenHandler.SamlSecurityTokenRequirement"></xref> property.
samlSecurityTokenRequirement is `null`.
Adds all of the delegates associated with the ActAs subject into the attribute collection.
The delegate of this <xref href="System.Security.Claims.ClaimsIdentity"></xref> object will be serialized into a <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAttribute"></xref>.
The delegate is specified by the <xref href="System.Security.Claims.ClaimsIdentity.Actor"></xref> property.
The attribute collection to which the ActAs token will be serialized.
The token descriptor.
subject is `null`.
-or-
tokenDescriptor is `null`.
urn:oasis:names:tc:SAML:1.0:assertion
urn:oasis:names:tc:SAML:1.0:cm:bearer
Indicates whether the current XML element can be read as a token of the type handled by this instance.
An XML reader positioned at a start element.
The reader should not be advanced.
`true` if the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSecurityTokenHandler.ReadToken(System.Xml.XmlReader)"></xref> method can read the element; otherwise, `false`.
Gets a value that indicates if this handler can validate tokens of type <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSecurityToken"></xref>.
This method overrides the base class method and always returns `true`.
`true`, which indicates that the handler can validate tokens of type <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSecurityToken"></xref>.
Gets a value that indicates whether this handler can serialize tokens of type <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSecurityToken"></xref>.
This method overrides the base class method and always returns `true`.
`true`; which indicates that the handler can serialize tokens of type <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSecurityToken"></xref>.
Gets or sets the X.509 certificate validator that is used by the current instance to validate X.509 certificates.
An <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Selectors.X509CertificateValidator"></xref> that represents the validator.
Collects attributes with a common claim type, claim value type, and original issuer into a single attribute with multiple values.
A collection of type <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAttribute"></xref> that contains the attributes generated from claims.
A collection of <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAttribute"></xref> that contains attributes derived from the input collection.

Attributes in the input collection that share a common claim type, claim value, and original issuer with other attributes are consolidated into a single attribute with multiple values in the output collection.
Attributes in the input collection that do not share claim type, claim value, or original issuer with other attributes appear unaltered in the output collection.
When overridden in a derived class, creates a <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAdvice"></xref> object for the assertion.
By default, this method returns `null`.
The token descriptor.
A <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAdvice"></xref> object.
The default is `null`.
Creates a <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAssertion"></xref> object by using the specified issuer, conditions, advice and statements.
You can override this method to customize the parameters used to create the assertion.
A unique random id is created for the assertion and the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAssertion.AssertionId%2A> property is set to this value.
The <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAssertion.IssueInstant%2A> is set to <xref:System.DateTime.UtcNow%2A>.
The issuer of the assertion.
The <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlConditions"></xref> to add to the assertion.
The <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAdvice"></xref> to add to the assertion.
The collection of <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlStatement"></xref> to add to the assertion.
The SAML assertion that was created.
Creates a <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAttribute"></xref> object from a claim.
The <xref href="System.Security.Claims.Claim"></xref> from which to generate the SAML Attribute.
The token descriptor.
A <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAttribute"></xref> that contains the converted claim.
claim is `null`.
Creates a <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAttributeStatement"></xref> object from a token descriptor.
This method may return `null` if the token descriptor does not contain any subject or the subject does not have any claims.
The <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSubject"></xref> to use in the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAttributeStatement"></xref> that is created.
The <xref href="System.Security.Claims.ClaimsIdentity"></xref> object that contains claims which will be converted to SAML Attributes.
The token descriptor.
A <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAttributeStatement"></xref> that contains the converted claims.
Creates a SAML 1.1 authentication statement from the specified authentication information.
The SamlSubject of the statement.
The <xref href="System.Security.Claims.AuthenticationInformation"></xref> from which to generate the SAML authentication statement.
Contains all the other information that is used in token issuance.
The SAML authentication statement that was created.
samlSubject is `null`.
-or-
tokenDescriptor is `null`.
Creates claims from a SAML 1.1 token.
A <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSecurityToken"></xref> that represents the security token from which to create the claims.
A <xref href="System.Security.Claims.ClaimsIdentity"></xref> that contains the claims extracted from the token.
samlSecurityToken is `null`.
The property of samlSecurityToken is `null`.
The handler is not configured or an issuer name registry is not configured for the handler.

(The <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSecurityTokenHandler.Configuration"></xref> property is `null` or is set to a <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityTokenHandlerConfiguration"></xref> with an <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityTokenHandlerConfiguration.IssuerNameRegistry"></xref> property that is `null`.
The issuer name returned by the configured issuer name registry for the security token (samlSecurityToken) is `null` or empty.
Creates the conditions for the assertion.
Generally, conditions should be included in assertions to limit the impact of misuse of the assertion.
Specifying the NotBefore and NotOnOrAfter conditions can limit the period of vulnerability in the case of a compromised assertion.

The AudienceRestrictionCondition can be used to explicitly state the intended relying party or parties of the assertion, which coupled with appropriate audience restriction enforcement at relying parties can help to mitigate spoofing attacks between relying parties.
The default implementation creates NotBefore and NotOnOrAfter conditions based on the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityTokenDescriptor.Lifetime%2A> property of the `tokenDescriptor`.

It will also generate an AudienceRestrictionCondition limiting consumption of the assertion to the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityTokenDescriptor.AppliesToAddress%2A> property of the `tokenDescriptor`.
The lifetime of the token.
The endpoint address for which the token is created.
The address is modeled as an AudienceRestriction condition.
The token descriptor.
A <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlConditions"></xref> object that contains the conditions for the assertion.
Creates a SAML 1.1 subject for the assertion.
The security token descriptor from which to create the subject.
A <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSubject"></xref> that represents the subject of the assertion.
tokenDescriptor is `null`.
Creates the security token reference when the token is not attached to the message.
The SAML token.
A value that indicates whether an attached or unattached reference should be created.
A <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityKeyIdentifierClause"></xref> that represents the token reference.
(An instance of <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAssertionKeyIdentifierClause"></xref> is actually returned.)
token is `null`.
Creates SAML 1.1 statements to be included in the assertion.
Statements are not required in a SAML 1.1 assertion.
This method may return an empty collection.
The token descriptor from which to create the statements.
An enumeration of <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlStatement"></xref> that contains the statements.
tokenDescriptor is `null`.
Creates a security token based on a token descriptor.
The token descriptor from which to create the security token.
A <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityToken"></xref> that represents the SAML 1.1 security token.
(The token returned is actually an instance of <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSecurityToken"></xref>.)
tokenDescriptor is `null`.
Creates a <xref href="System.Security.Principal.WindowsIdentity"></xref> object using the specified User Principal Name (UPN).
The UPN to use to create the identity.
The Windows identity that was created.
upn is `null` or an empty string.
Builds an XML formatted string from a collection of SAML 1.1 attributes that represent the Actor.
The string is of the form "\<Actor>\<Attribute name, ns>\<AttributeValue>...\</AttributeValue>, ...\</Attribute>...\</Actor>"
An enumeration of type <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAttribute"></xref> that contains the attributes.
A well-formed XML string constructed using the attributes.
Returns the SAML11 authentication method identifier that matches the specified normalized value for a SAML authentication method.
The <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSecurityTokenHandler.DenormalizeAuthenticationType%2A> method returns the SAML11 authentication method identifier that matches the specified normalized URI.

For example, if <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.AuthenticationMethods.X509> is specified for `normalizedAuthenticationType`, the following URI is returned: `urn:oasis:names:tc:SAML:1.0:am:X509-PKI`.
If a mapping does not exist for `normalizedAuthenticationType`, it is returned unaltered.
The normalized value.
One of the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.AuthenticationMethods"></xref> values.
The SAML11 authentication method identifier (URI) that matches the specified normalized identifier.
If no matching SAML11 authentication method is found, the normalizedAuthenticationType URI is returned unaltered.
Throws an exception if the specified token already exists in the token replay cache; otherwise the token is added to the cache.
The default behavior is to only check bearer tokens (tokens that do not have keys).

The token replay cache is the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.TokenReplayCache> object configured for this handler through the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityTokenHandlerConfiguration.TokenReplayCache%2A> property of the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityTokenHandlerConfiguration> object referenced through the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityTokenHandler.Configuration%2A> property.

A <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityToken"></xref> that represents the SAML 1.1 security token (the token should be of type <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSecurityToken"></xref>) to be checked.
token is `null`.
The <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityTokenHandler.Configuration"></xref> property is `null`.
-or-

The <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityTokenHandlerConfiguration.TokenReplayCache"></xref> property of the handler configuration (accessed through the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityTokenHandler.Configuration"></xref> property) is `null`.
token cannot be cast as an instance of .
The ID of the assertion associated with the token is `null` or empty.

(The <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSecurityToken.Assertion"></xref> property of the token references a <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAssertion"></xref> that has an <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAssertion.Id"></xref> property that references a <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlId"></xref> with a <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlId.Value"></xref> property that is `null` or empty.)
The token already exists in the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.TokenReplayCache"></xref>.

Finds the UPN claim value in the specified <xref href="System.Security.Claims.ClaimsIdentity"></xref> object for the purpose of mapping the identity to a <xref href="System.Security.Claims.WindowsClaimsIdentity"></xref> object.
The claims identity object containing the desired UPN claim.
A string that contains the UPN claim value found.
Gets the token encrypting credentials.
Override this method to change the token encrypting credentials.
The default implementation retrieves the encrypting credentials from the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityTokenDescriptor.EncryptingCredentials%2A> property of the `tokenDescriptor`.
Retrieves some scope encrypting credentials from the Scope object.
An <xref href="System.IdentityModel.SecurityTokenService.EncryptingCredentials"></xref> that represents the token encrypting credentials.
tokenDescriptor is `null`.
The encrypting credentials retrieved from the token descriptor are asymmetric.
Gets the credentials for signing the assertion.
SAML2 assertions used as security tokens should be signed.
The default implementation uses the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityTokenDescriptor.SigningCredentials%2A> property of the `tokenDescriptor` to retrieve the credentials.
The token descriptor.
A <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SigningCredentials"></xref> that represents the credentials for signing the assertion.
tokenDescriptor is `null`.
Returns the time until which the token should be held in the token replay cache.
By default, this method returns the NotOnOrAfter of the SAML Condition if present.
If that value does not exist, it returns the NotOnOrAfter of the first SubjectConfirmationData.
This function will never return a value further from the current time (<xref:System.DateTime.Now%2A>) than Configuration.TokenReplayCacheExpirationPeriod.
The token for which to return the expiration time.
A <xref href="System.DateTime"></xref> that represents the expiration time.
token is `null`.
Gets the token type identifier(s) supported by this handler.
An array of strings that contains the token type identifier(s) supported by this handler.
Gets or sets the security token serializer that is used to serialize and deserialize key identifiers.
Serializes and deserializes <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityKeyIdentifier> objects.
A <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Selectors.SecurityTokenSerializer"></xref> that represents the serializer.
An attempt to set the value to `null` occurs.
Loads custom configuration from XML.
An <xref href="System.Xml.XmlNodeList"></xref> that specifies the SAML token authentication requirements.
customConfigElements is `null`.
The configuration specified in customConfigElements is not valid.
urn:oasis:names:tc:SAML:1.0
Returns the normalized value that matches a SAML 1.1 authentication method identifier.

The <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSecurityTokenHandler.NormalizeAuthenticationType%2A> method returns the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.AuthenticationMethods> value that matches the specified SAML11 authentication method identifier.
For example, if `urn:oasis:names:tc:SAML:1.0:am:X509-PKI` is specified for `saml11AuthenticationMethod`, <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.AuthenticationMethods.X509> is returned.
If a mapping does not exist for `saml11AuthenticationMethod`, it is returned unaltered.
The SAML 1.1 authentication method identifier (URI) to normalize.
The normalized value, which is one of the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.AuthenticationMethods"></xref> values.
If no matching value exists, saml11AuthenticationMethod is returned, unaltered.
Creates claims from a SAML 1.1 attribute statement and adds them to the specified subject.
The created claims are added to the subject.
The <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAttributeStatement"></xref> from which the claims are created.
The subject to which the claims are added.
The issuer.
samlStatement is `null`.
-or-
subject is `null`.
Creates claims from a SAML 1.1 authentication statement and adds them to the specified subject.
The <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAuthenticationStatement"></xref> from which the claims are created.
The subject to which the claims are added.
The issuer.
samlStatement is `null`.
-or-
subject is `null`.
Creates claims from a SAML 1.1 authorization decision statement and adds them to the specified subject.
The default implementation does nothing.
The <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAuthorizationDecisionStatement"></xref> from which the claims are created.
The subject to which the claims are added.
The issuer.
Creates claims from the SAML 1.1 subject and adds them to the specified subject.
The <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSubject"></xref> from which the claims are created.
The subject to which the claims are added.
The issuer.
samlSubject is `null`.
Creates claims from a collection of SAML 1.1 statements and adds them to the specified subject.
The SAML statements from which the claims are created.
The subject to which the claims are added.
The issuer.
statements is `null`.
Reads the <saml:Action> element.
An <xref href="System.Xml.XmlReader"></xref> positioned at the element to read.
A <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAction"></xref> that represents the Action element that is read.
reader is `null`.
Reads the <saml:Advice> element.
The Advice element has an extensibility point to allow XML elements from non-SAML 1.1 namespaces to be included.
By default, because the Advice may be ignored without affecting the semantics of the assertion, any such elements are ignored.
To handle the processing of those elements, override this method.
An <xref href="System.Xml.XmlReader"></xref> positioned at the element to read.
A <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAdvice"></xref> that represents the Advice element that is read.
reader is `null`.
Reads the <saml:Assertion> element.
An <xref href="System.Xml.XmlReader"></xref> positioned at the element to read.
A <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAssertion"></xref> that represents the Assertion element that is read.
reader is `null`.
Reads the <saml:Attribute> element.
The default implementation requires that the content of the Attribute element be a simple string.
To handle complex content or content of declared simple types other than xs:string, override this method.
An <xref href="System.Xml.XmlReader"></xref> positioned at the element to read.
A <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAssertion"></xref> that represents the Assertion element that is read.
reader is `null`.
Reads the <saml:AttributeStatement> element, or a <saml:Statement> element that specifies an xsi:type of saml:AttributeStatementType.
An <xref href="System.Xml.XmlReader"></xref> positioned at the element to read.
A <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAttributeStatement"></xref> that represents the element that is read.
reader is `null`.
Reads an attribute value.
An <xref href="System.Xml.XmlReader"></xref> positioned at the element to read.
The attribute being read.
A string that contains the attribute value.
reader is `null`.
Reads the <saml:AudienceRestrictionCondition> element from the specified XML reader.
An XML reader positioned at the <saml:AudienceRestrictionCondition> element to read.
A <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAudienceRestrictionCondition"></xref> that represents the element that was read.
reader is `null`.
Reads the <saml:AuthnStatement> element or a <saml:Statement> element that specifies an xsi:type of saml:AuthnStatementType.
An <xref href="System.Xml.XmlReader"></xref> positioned at the element to read.
A <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAuthenticationStatement"></xref> that represents the element that is read.
reader is `null`.
Read the <saml:AuthorityBinding> element.
An XML reader positioned at the <saml:AuthorityBinding> element
The <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAuthorityBinding"></xref> that was read.
reader is `null`.
reader is not positioned at a saml:AuthorityBinding element or contains an unrecognized child element or a child element that is not valid.
Reads the <saml:AuthzDecisionStatement> element or a <saml:Statement> element that specifies an xsi:type of saml:AuthzDecisionStatementType.
An <xref href="System.Xml.XmlReader"></xref> positioned at the element to read.
A <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAuthorizationStatement"></xref> that represents the element that is read.
reader is `null`.
Reads a saml:AudienceRestrictionCondition or a saml:DoNotCacheCondition from the specified reader
The reader from which to read the element.
The <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlCondition"></xref> that was read from the XML.
reader is `null`.
reader is positioned at an unknown element.
Reads the <saml:Conditions> element.
To handle custom \<saml:Condition> elements, override this method.
An <xref href="System.Xml.XmlReader"></xref> positioned at the element to read.
A <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlConditions"></xref> that represents the Conditions element that is read.
reader is `null`.
reader is not positioned at a Conditions element.
Reads a saml:DoNotCacheCondition element from the specified XML reader.
An XML reader positioned at a saml:DoNotCacheCondition element
The <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlDoNotCacheCondition"></xref> that was read.
reader is `null`.
reader is not positioned at a saml:DoNotCacheCondition element.

An <xref href="System.Xml.XmlReader"></xref> positioned at the element to read.
A <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlEvidence"></xref> that represents the Evidence element that is read.
reader is `null`.
Deserializes the SAML Signing KeyInfo.
An XmlReader that can be positioned at a ds:KeyInfo element.
The assertion that is having the signature checked.
The <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityKeyIdentifier"></xref> that represents the key to use to check the signature.
reader is `null`.
Reads the <saml:Statement> element.
The default implementation only handles Statement elements that specify an xsi:type of saml:AttributeStatementType, saml:AuthnStatementType, and saml:AuthzDecisionStatementType.
To handle custom statements, override this method.
An <xref href="System.Xml.XmlReader"></xref> positioned at the element to read.
A <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlStatement"></xref> that represents the Statement element that was read.
reader is `null`.
Reads the <saml:Subject> element.
The default implementation does not handle the optional \<EncryptedID> element.
To handle encryped IDs in the Subject, override this method.
An <xref href="System.Xml.XmlReader"></xref> positioned at the element to read.
A <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSubject"></xref> that represents the Subject element that was read.
reader is `null`.
Deserializes the SAML Subject <ds:KeyInfo> element.
An <xref href="System.Xml.XmlReader"></xref> positioned at a <ds:KeyInfo> element.
A <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityKeyIdentifier"></xref> that represents the contents of the <ds:KeyInfo> element.
reader is `null`.
Reads a SAML 1.1 token from the specified stream.
A <xref href="System.Xml.XmlReader"></xref> stream to a SAML 1.1 Security Token.
An instance of <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSecurityToken"></xref>.
The <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityTokenHandler.Configuration"></xref> property is `null`.
-or-

The <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityTokenHandlerConfiguration.IssuerTokenResolver"></xref> property of the configuration specified by the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityTokenHandler.Configuration"></xref> property is `null`.
-or-

The <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityTokenHandlerConfiguration.ServiceTokenResolver"></xref> property of the configuration specified by the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityTokenHandler.Configuration"></xref> property is `null`.
Resolves the Signing Key Identifier to a <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityToken"></xref>.
The <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAssertion"></xref> for which the Issuer token is to be resolved.
The current <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Selectors.SecurityTokenResolver"></xref> associated with this handler.
A <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityToken"></xref> that represents the resolved token.
assertion is `null`.
The handler is unable to resolve the token.
Resolves the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityKeyIdentifier"></xref> specified in a saml:Subject element.
The key identifier to resolve into a key.
The key resolved from the key identifier.
Gets or sets the security token requirements for this instance.
A <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSecurityTokenRequirement"></xref> that specifies the requirements.
An attempt to set the value to `null` occurs.
This method gets called when a special type of <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAttribute"></xref> is detected.

The <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAttribute"></xref> passed in wraps a <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAttribute"></xref> that contains a collection of attribute values (in the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAttribute.Values"></xref> property), each of which will get mapped to a claim.
All of the claims will be returned in an <xref href="System.Security.Claims.ClaimsIdentity"></xref> with the specified issuer.
The <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAttribute"></xref> to use.
The <xref href="System.Security.Claims.ClaimsIdentity"></xref> that is the subject of this token.
The issuer of the claim.
The <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAttribute"></xref> does not contain any valid attribute values.
Gets the token type supported by this handler.
The <xref href="System.Type"></xref> of the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSecurityToken"></xref> class.
Resolves the Signing Key Identifier to a SecurityToken.
The <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAssertion"></xref> for which the Issuer token is to be resolved.
The current <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Selectors.SecurityTokenResolver"></xref> associated with this handler.
When this method returns, contains the resolved security token if a token was successfully resolved.
`true` if the token is resolved.
urn:oasis:names:tc:SAML:1.0:am:unspecified
Validates the specified <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlConditions"></xref> object.
Throws an appropriate exception if the condition is not valid.
The token may not be valid for a number of reasons.
For example, the current time may not be within the token's validity period, the token may contain data that is contradictory or not valid, or the token may contain unsupported SAML 1.1 elements.
The SAML 1.1 condition to be validated.
`true` to check for Audience Restriction condition.
Validates the token data and returns its claims.
Throws an appropriate exception if the token is not valid.
The SAML 1.1 token to be validated.
The identities contained in the token.
Writes the <saml:Action> element.
The <xref href="System.Xml.XmlWriter"></xref> with which to write the data.
The data to write.
action is `null`.
-or-
writer is `null`.
Writes the <saml:Advice> element.
The <xref href="System.Xml.XmlWriter"></xref> with which to write the data.

Serializes the specified SAML assertion to the specified XML writer.
The <xref href="System.Xml.XmlWriter"></xref> to use for the serialization.
A <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAssertion"></xref> that represents the assertion to serialize.
writer is `null`.
-or-
assertion is `null`.
The assertion specified by assertion has both the and properties set to `null`.
-or-
There are no statements and no subject in the assertion specified by data.

(Both the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAssertion.Subject"></xref> property and the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAssertion.Statements"></xref> property are `null`.) If an assertion does not contain statements, it must contain a subject.
-or-
The assertion specified by assertion contains an authentication, attribute, or authorization decision statement and no subjectâ€”these statements require a subject.

(The <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAssertion.Statements"></xref> property contains a statement of type <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAttributeStatement"></xref>, <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAuthenticationStatement"></xref>, or <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAuthorizationDecisionStatement"></xref> and the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAssertion.Subject"></xref> property is `null`).
The token encrypting credentials do not have a Symmetric Key specified.

Serializes the specified <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlCondition"></xref> object.

By default, the method invokes either the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSecurityTokenHandler.WriteAudienceRestrictionCondition%2A> or <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSecurityTokenHandler.WriteDoNotCacheCondition%2A> method to serialize the condition based on the type of <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlCondition> specified.
The <xref href="System.Xml.XmlWriter"></xref> with which to write the data.
The data to write.
By default, only <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAudienceRestrictionCondition"></xref> and <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlDoNotCacheCondition"></xref> are supported.
condition is `null`.
-or-
writer is `null`.
condition is not supported.
By default, only <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAudienceRestrictionCondition"></xref> and <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlDoNotCacheCondition"></xref> are supported.
